results.title: William's doll
results.creator_credit: Roberto Carlo Chiesa and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: A young boy finally gets the doll that he has been longing for when his grandfather visits. Intended to show the value of allowing children to grow up without false ideas about masculinity and femininity. Based on the book William’s Doll by Charlotte Zolotow. Suitable for middle primary level.

results.title: The Three monks
results.brief_description: An animated story about co-operation in which three monks squabble over the chore of fetching water to put out the fire in their temple. Considers the benefit of teamwork as opposed to thinking only of oneself.
results.description: An animated story about co-operation in which three monks squabble over the chore of fetching water to put out the fire in their temple. Considers the benefit of teamwork as opposed to thinking only of oneself.

results.title: A Queer patient
results.creator_credit: Pu Jia-Xiang and Shanghai Animation Film Studio
results.brief_description: A tale from China centred around the theme of the wolf in sheep’s clothing. A caterpillar admits herself to the animal hospital after becoming ill from eating leaves of protected plants. Unfortunately for her, this is discovered by the medical staff who decide not to let her out. However, the caterpillar metamorphoses into a butterfly and seeks to deceive the hospital staff by playing on the fact that nothing as beautiful as she could do anything destructive. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Mole and the matchbox
results.brief_description: In this animated story, the Mole comes upon a matchbox. The Mole and the Mouse then devise many amusing activities with the box and the matches, accidentally discovering the true purpose of matches. Without narration.

results.title: The Hoffnung vacuum cleaner
results.creator_credit: Derek Lamb, John Halas, BBC-TV and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Hoffnung”.
A story about a housewife who is sold a musical vacuum cleaner by a door to door salesman and subsequently ascends to the heights of musical fame due to her prowess with this instrument. Unfortunately, her chauvinist husband does not cope well with his wife’s new found career. This film raises issues about male and female roles. Animation by Leslie Drew, music by Frances Chagrin and storyboard by Derek Lamb.

results.title: Lincoln County incident
results.brief_description: A satiric western set in the South Island of New Zealand with a cast and crew of over 100 - all children from a New Zealand secondary school. It involves the escapades of diminutive Sampson Peabody-Jones who, in 1881, heads west in search of adventure and a new life. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Outer planets
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance and Media Four Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Solar System”.
Uses special effects to create the impression of what is known of the outer planets - Jupitor, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, Pluto. Explains why life cannot be sustained on these planets. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Inner planets
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance and Media Four Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Solar System”.
Uses special effects to create an impression of what is known of the structural character of the inner planets - Mercury, Venus and Mars. explains why life cannot be sustained on these planets. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Moon
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance and Stanton Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Solar System”.
Provides information about the structural characteristics of the Moon and its effect on our planet. Shows that the moon is a satellite of the Earth, that its gravity is different to that of Earth, how it affects the Earth’s tides and why its surface is pitted with craters. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Earth
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Media Four Productions and Stanton Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Solar System”.
Provides information about the planet Earth - how its distance from the sun is the optimum distance for sustaining life, the notions of rotation and gravitational pull, the earth’s structure and the movement of the Earth’s crust, i.e., tectonic plates.
